title: Monthly Billiard News Round-Up — February
excerpt: World Champions Crowned, Masters Dominated, and a New World Cup Unveiled! From historic world championship triumphs in pool to dominant performances on the snooker table and groundbreaking announcements for the future of cue sports.
content:
## World Champions Crowned, Masters Dominated, and a New World Cup Unveiled!

What a whirlwind of action the billiard world has witnessed recently! From historic world championship triumphs in pool to dominant performances on the snooker table and groundbreaking announcements for the future of cue sports, there's been no shortage of excitement.

## Seo Seoa Claims 2025 Kamui WPA Women's 9-Ball World Championship

The pinnacle of women's 9-ball pool has found its new queen! South Korea's [Seo Seoa was sensationally crowned the 2025 Kamui WPA Women's 9-Ball World Champion](https://wpapool.com/seo-seoa-crowned-2025-kamui-wpa-womens-9-ball-world-champion-as-predator-pro-billiard-series-concludes-a-landmark-season/). This monumental victory capped off a truly landmark season for the Predator Pro Billiard Series, which continues to elevate women's professional pool to new heights.

Seo Seoa's triumph not only marks a significant milestone in her burgeoning career but also underscores the immense talent and fierce competition prevalent at the highest echelons of the women's game. Her strategic play and flawless execution captivated audiences, solidifying her place among the sport's elite.

## Judd Trump Dominates Again at the German Masters

Across the felt to the green baize, snooker sensation [Judd Trump once again asserted his mastery at the Tempodrom](https://wpbsa.com/trump-masters-the-tempodrom-again/), securing the German Masters title. This repeat performance at such a prestigious and atmospheric venue further cements Trump's reputation as one of snooker's most consistent and formidable competitors.

The Tempodrom, known for its passionate crowds and electric energy, once again bore witness to Trump's exceptional potting, tactical brilliance, and calm under immense pressure. His victory wasn't merely another trophy added to his impressive cabinet; it was a powerful statement about his enduring form and his unparalleled ability to perform at his peak in front of a devoted European audience.

## WPA Announces Historic Heyball World Cup

Looking keenly to the future, the World Pool-Billiard Association (WPA) has made a monumental announcement that could redefine a significant segment of cue sports globally. They've unveiled the [introduction of the WPA Heyball World Cup](https://wpapool.com/a-new-historic-beginning-for-heyball-introducing-the-wpa-heyball-world-cup/), heralding what they term a "new historic beginning for Heyball."

This exciting new event signifies a global strategic push to elevate Heyball, a thrilling discipline that uniquely combines elements of Chinese 8-ball and American pool, onto the international stage. The WPA Heyball World Cup aims to bring together the best Heyball players from around the globe, offering a prestigious platform for elite competition and fostering greater recognition for this rapidly growing and increasingly popular format.

## What's Next for the Billiard World?

With new world champions crowned and a major new international event on the horizon, the billiard world continues to evolve at a thrilling pace. These stories collectively highlight the rich diversity and global appeal of cue sports, from the precision and pressure of 9-ball to the strategic depth of snooker, and the emerging excitement of Heyball.

Stay tuned for more updates as these champions prepare to defend their hard-won titles and as the inaugural WPA Heyball World Cup takes shape! The future of billiards is looking brighter than ever.

---

*This roundup is compiled from various sources around the billiard world. For the latest updates, follow us on Instagram.*

title: Monthly Billiard News Round-Up — January
excerpt: Seo Crowned World Champion, WPA Celebrates Landmark Year, and Snooker Legends Shine! What a whirlwind of action the world of billiards has seen recently.
content:
## Billiards Bulletin: Seo Crowned World Champion, WPA Celebrates Landmark Year, and Snooker Legends Shine!

What a whirlwind of action the world of billiards has seen recently! From nail-biting world championships to triumphant comebacks and a governing body celebrating a banner year, there's no shortage of excitement for fans across all disciplines. Let's dive into the latest news from around the world of cue sports.

## Seoa Seo Secures Historic Women's 9-Ball World Championship Title

The cue sports world watched in awe as South Korea's **Seoa Seo** etched her name into history, claiming the coveted Kamui WPA Women's 9-Ball World Championship title. Her victory wasn't just a win; it was a story of redemption, culminating in an epic rematch that had fans on the edge of their seats.

The World Pool-Billiard Association (WPA) highlighted her triumph as a fitting conclusion to a "landmark season" for the Predator Pro Billiard Series. This championship underscored Seo's undeniable skill and mental fortitude, solidifying her status as a global force in women's pool.

## WPA Reflects on a Remarkable 2025, Eyes Brighter 2026

Beyond individual triumphs, the broader landscape of pool is thriving, according to the World Pool-Billiard Association (WPA). The organization recently issued a statement celebrating a "remarkable 2025," citing successful tournaments, increased participation, and growing global interest.

This reflection isn't just a look back; it's a springboard for an "even brighter 2026," promising continued innovation and expansion within the sport. The WPA's proactive approach in fostering growth and supporting events like the Predator Pro Billiard Series ensures that pool remains a dynamic and engaging sport for both players and spectators worldwide.

## Joe Perry Delights in Derby, Crowned British Seniors Snooker Open Champion

Meanwhile, on the green baize of snooker, veteran sensation Joe Perry brought the house down in Derby, clinching the 2025 JenningsBet British Seniors Snooker Open title. Perry's performance was a masterclass in experience and precision, showcasing that the legends of the game still possess the magic to thrill.

This victory adds another prestigious trophy to his impressive cabinet and keeps the seniors' circuit vibrant and competitive. Fans of snooker also witnessed Chris Wakelin crowned champion in Edinburgh, further highlighting the ongoing excitement and high-stakes competition within the sport.

---

The world of billiards, in all its forms, is clearly enjoying a golden era. From the strategic depths of 9-ball to the precision of snooker, the passion and skill of its athletes continue to shine. We eagerly anticipate what the rest of the year, and indeed 2026, will bring to these thrilling sports!

---

*This roundup is compiled from various sources around the billiard world. For the latest updates, follow us on Instagram.*

content:
## Billiard Buzz: World Champions Crowned, Future Tours Unveiled, and Inclusive Triumphs!

Greetings, billiard fanatics! It's your dedicated reporter, cueing up the hottest news from around the globe. This past period has been nothing short of electrifying, with monumental victories, groundbreaking tour announcements, and inspiring showcases of talent that continue to elevate our beloved sport.

## Seo Seoa Dominates: Crowned 2025 Kamui WPA Women's 9-Ball World Champion

The billiard world watched in awe as the 2025 Kamui WPA Women's 9-Ball World Championship culminated in a spectacular fashion, with South Korea's own Seo Seoa claiming the coveted title. Held as a highlight of the Predator Pro Billiard Series, this event concluded a landmark season, underscoring the incredible skill and fierce competition present in women's professional pool.

Seo Seoa's triumph isn't just a personal victory; it's a testament to the growing global presence and undeniable talent emerging from Asia, further solidifying her status as a formidable force on the international stage.

## The Future is Bright: World Nineball Tour Reveals Blockbuster 2026 Schedule

Looking ahead, the landscape of professional pool is set to undergo a significant evolution with the World Nineball Tour's exciting unveiling of its initial 2026 schedule. This "first wave" announcement promises a blockbuster year for players and fans alike, hinting at an expanded, more dynamic circuit.

While specific locations and prize details are still emerging, the commitment to a comprehensive global tour demonstrates a clear vision for the sport's growth and increased professionalism. This ambitious schedule will undoubtedly provide more opportunities for top-tier talent to compete, earn, and showcase their skills on a grander scale.

## Inspiration on the Baize: European Billiards Champions for Athletes with Disabilities Crowned

In a truly inspiring display of dedication and talent, the European Pool Championships for Athletes with Disabilities in Starachowice, Poland, celebrated its 2025 champions. Poland's Adam Wilk and Cyprus's Georgios Malekkidis were crowned European Billiards Champions, showcasing exceptional skill and sportsmanship.

This championship, proudly recognized by both AZBilliards and the WPA, highlights the sport's unwavering commitment to inclusivity and provides a vital platform for athletes with disabilities to compete at an elite level. Their victories are not just about winning titles; they are powerful examples of perseverance, challenging perceptions and proving that the spirit of competition thrives across all abilities.

---

From world-class champions to thrilling future tours and heartwarming inclusive competitions, the world of billiards continues to captivate and inspire. We'll keep our eyes on the pockets and bring you all the latest as these stories develop!

---

*This roundup is compiled from various sources around the billiard world. For the latest updates, follow us on Instagram.*

title: Weekly Billiard News Round-Up (12/17/2025)
excerpt: Unbeaten Runs, National Glory, and Seniors Triumphs Dominate Cue Sports Headlines! From rising stars making their mark with flawless performances to seasoned veterans proving their enduring class.
content:
## Weekly Wrap-Up: Unbeaten Runs, National Glory, and Seniors Triumphs Dominate Cue Sports Headlines!

What a week it's been for the world of cue sports! From rising stars making their mark with flawless performances to national champions showcasing their prowess, and seasoned veterans proving their enduring class, the tables have been buzzing with incredible action.

## Acosta Achieves Undefeated Glory at GSPT Grand Amateur Championships

First up, a truly dominant display at the **GSPT Grand Amateur Championships**, where Acosta etched their name into the history books with an impeccable undefeated run! To navigate an entire tournament without a single loss is a testament to unwavering focus, strategic brilliance, and nerves of steel.

This wasn't just a win; it was a masterclass in consistency and execution. Acosta's flawless performance captivated audiences and firmly established them as a formidable force to be reckoned with in the amateur circuit. Such victories don't just secure a title; they inspire countless aspiring players and highlight the depth of talent rising through the ranks.

## Polish Championship MVPs: Daniel Macioł and Oliwia Zalewska Crowned

Across the continent, the **Polish Championship** delivered double excitement as it honored its Most Valuable Players: Daniel Macioł for the men's division and Oliwia Zalewska for the women's. National championships are the bedrock of any sport, and Poland's top billiards talents certainly delivered.

Macioł's triumph underscores his consistency and clutch play throughout the event, proving why he stands at the pinnacle of Polish men's billiards. Similarly, Zalewska's exceptional performance demonstrates the incredible skill and growing competitive spirit within the women's game.

## Daniel Ward Claims Maiden Seniors Snooker Title in Emotional Victory

Finally, a heartwarming story of perseverance and triumph from the green baize as Daniel Ward captured his very first **Seniors Snooker Title**! In a hard-fought contest, Ward emerged victorious against the formidable Gerard Greene, marking a significant milestone in his career.

Winning a maiden title, especially on the competitive Seniors circuit which often features former world champions and legends, is an emotional and deeply satisfying achievement. It speaks volumes about the dedication, experience, and enduring passion that players like Ward bring to the sport.

---

What an eventful week! These stories — from Acosta's undefeated streak to Macioł and Zalewska's national recognition and Ward's poignant maiden win — truly highlight the global appeal and diverse talent within the world of cue sports. Keep those cues chalked, and stay tuned for more thrilling updates!

---

*This roundup is compiled from various sources around the billiard world. For the latest updates, follow us on Instagram.*
